column2: Curation
Access to information
LO1 : Demonstrate effective search skills
1.1 Locate online information with search engines using simple keywords or phrases
1.2 Locate online information with given URL and specific hyperlinks
1.3 Locate information within a device or application using a search function
1.4 Refine internet search by refining keywords, with advanced searches and Boolean Operators
1.5 Reverse Image Search
1.6 Tapping on an online community to seek required information
1.7 Using hashtags
LO2: Practise safe and ethical search
2.1 Filtering sites with inappropriate content
2.2 Protect personal data privacy when using internet search engines
2.3 Protect personal data privacy when using social media platforms to search for information
Information Management
LO3: Organise digital information (from a wide variety of sources) using appropriate data management tools and strategies
3.1 Offline folders
3.2 Bookmarking features
3.3 Online bookmarking tools and online tagging system
3.4 Using aggregators to receive regular updates of information from multiple online sources
Inquiry of information
LO4: Determine reliability of information
4.1 Determine reliability of information by the currency and accuracy of web resources
4.2 Determine reliability of information by the in-text citation and links to the source that supports the information
4.3 Determine reliability of information by verifying the online reputation of the publisher
LO5: Verify information to make discerning choice
5.1 Distinguish facts from opinions
Proactive risk evaluation and management
LO6: Adopt a proactive stance to maintain online safety
6.1 Guidelines for setting passwords
6.2 Procedures or guidelines for personal safety and security online.
6.3 Dealing with inappropriate online content
6.4 Prevent and minimise security risks in various online situations
6.5 Online security hazards
Creation
Production
LO7: Use digital creation tools and applications to create a digital artefact efficiently
7.1 Manage information in a digital text
7.2 Visual literacy
7.3 Graphs or charts in a digital text
7.4 Editing audio files
7.5 Editing video files
Design
LO8: Effectively utilise appropriate digital creation tools and applications to create digital text-based and/ or multimodal products for personal, academic and functional purposes
8.1 Planning the creation of digital artefacts
8.2 Selecting appropriate medium and digital tools
8.3 Creating effective presentations
8.4 Creating digital advertisement
8.5 Creating digital story
8.6 Planning a data study
LO9: Apply fundamental understanding of ethical/ legal issues surrounding the creation and sharing of digital creation
9.1 Copyright and copyright infringement
9.2 Creative Commons (CC) and plagiarism
9.3 Being sensitive when creating digital artefacts
Connecting with others
Communication of information
LO10: Use appropriate digital communication tools and strategies to share information with the intended viewers
10.1 Understand the purpose and considerations for communicating and sharing information synchronously with different groups of viewers
10.2 Use appropriate digital tools to communicate and share information with intended viewers
10.3 Learn to communicate and share information in a responsible and ethical manner
10.4 Ways to communicate and share information effectively using social media apps
Participation in a community
LO11: Participate in a community actively
11.1 Understand the characteristics of an online community
11.2 Ways to participate actively and contribute in an online community
11.3 Knowing our digital rights and responsibilities and ways to creating a positive presence and influence online
Participation
LO12: Manage personal online identity and reputation
12.1 Recognise the types of information not to be shared online and possible risks/ consequences if we share them
12.2 Understand privacy settings , privacy policies and privacy controls
12.3 Precautions to take to protect one�s online identity
12.4 Managing personal online identity and online reputation
LO13: Demonstrate appreciation for diversity and social cohesion
13.1 Internet etiquette in communication
13.2 Responding open-mindedly to different ideas and values
Productivity Tools
Personal Productivity
LO14: Effectively utilise appropriate digital tools to manage own schedule
14.1 Managing own schedule through appropriate digital tools
LO15: Effectively utilise appropriate digital tools and applications to organise own learning
15.1 Organising learning through annotation
15.2 Organising learning through note-taking
LO16: Effectively utilise appropriate online office productivity tools to create reports or presentations to document own learning
16.1 Documenting learning through digital text and graphics
16.2 Documenting learning through organising and processing data
16.3 Documenting learning through presentation slides
Group Productivity
LO17: Effectively utilise appropriate digital tools and applications to work with others and share information
17.1 Working with others and sharing information through digital file sharing
17.2 Working with others and sharing information through digital mind-mapping tools
17.3 Working with others and sharing information through online bulletin board
LO18: Effectively utilise video-conferencing tools to communicate with peers
18.1 Communicating with peers through video-conferencing tools
Find
Digital Safety and Security
Adopt a proactive stance to maintain online safety
F1.1b Protect oneself from becoming victims of hacking and virus infection by installing firewalls, updating operating systems and installing antivirus software
Digital Information Management
Demonstrate effective search skills
F2.1e(i) Refine internet search by using advanced search filters in the advanced search function settings
F2.1e(ii) Refine generative AI prompts to obtain desired output
F2.1f Conduct reverse search of information with reverse image search
F2.1g Tap on online communities to seek required information and tap on social media platforms to seek required information and the use of hashtags
Practice safe and ethical search
F2.1j Know potential dangers when searching for information on social media platforms (e.g. impersonation, phishing, web threats) and four strategies to protect personal data
Organise digital information (from a wide variety of sources) using appropriate data management tools and strategies
F2.2c Keep a record of online information using online bookmarking tools and employ an online tagging system to organise digital information
F2.2d Employ means to receive regular updates of information from multiple online sources using online aggregators
Determine reliability of information
F2.3c Identify web sources published by the same author/publisher/organisation to verify the online reputation of the publisher
Verify information to make discerning choice
F2.3d(i) Distinguish facts from opinions
F2.3d(ii) Determine accuracy and completeness of information by cross-checking multiple web sources
F2.3d(iii) Apply S.U.R.E. to determine the accuracy and completeness of information and to verify information and examine perspectives to make a discerning choice
Digital Responsibility
Apply fundamental understanding of ethical/legal issues surrounding the creation and sharing of digital creation
F3.1c Be aware of possible differing views, opinions and perspectives and the extent of the impact and consequences of being insensitive
Use appropriate digital communication tools and strategies to share information with the intended viewers
F3.2d(i) Understand about the features and characteristics of social media for communication and information exchange with other users
F3.2d(ii) Know what social media apps and strategies can be used to share information to intended users appropriately and effectively (strategy of selective attention)
Participate in a community actively

F3.3c Know rights and responsibilities of the individuals in online communities (respect others, protect own data online, standards for responsible and respectful speech and actions) and examples of how to create a positive presence and influence online
Manage personal online identity and reputation
F3.3g Know what is a digital footprint and how to inspect one’s own digital footprint (e.g. online name searches, comments/tags of personal information by others, use of social media analytics)
Demonstrate appreciation for diversity and social cohesion
F3.3i Be open-minded to different perspectives that others have using Ladder of Feedback and being aware of internet trolls
Think
Data Competencies
Analyse and present data, and investigate problems using data with an awareness of common fallacies in data and data presentation

T1.1b(i) Use the three steps to plan a data study i.e. identify the problem, what, who and how to collect data to determine the appropriate data collection tool and how to analyse the data to determine the appropriate data analysis tool
T1.1b(ii) Recognise and avoid common fallacies in datasets and data presentation and how to avoid being misled
Apply
Device and Software Operations
Effectively utilise appropriate digital tools to manage own schedule
A1.1a Know the why and how of using digital tools to schedule and do calendering
Effectively utilise appropriate digital tools and applications to organise own learning
A1.2a Know the why and how to organise learning through annotation on digital files
A1.2b Know the why and how to organise learning through note-taking using digital tools
Create
Digital Communication, Collaboration and Participation
Use digital creation tools and applications to create a digital artefact efficiently
C1.1c Considerations for editing audio files
C1.1d Considerations for editing video files
Effectively utilise appropriate digital creation tools and applications to create digital text-based and/or multimodal products for personal, academic and functional purposes
C1.2d Consider audience, purpose and context in creating digital advertisement so that the most appropriate modes, mediums, digital creation tools and media platforms can be selected
C1.2e Consider how various media elements (text, images, audio, video) are being integrated into a multimedia digital artefact to form a coherent key message for the intended audience
Effectively utilise digital tools and applications to work with others and share information
C1.3c Know why learning can be enhanced through collaborating through digital mind-mapping tools
